unnormalised: RBI's (Reserve Bank of India) recent announcement about unchanged repo rates – well, it’s like ordering biryani and getting plain rice. Again. Banks are still charging an arm and a leg for personal loans. HDFC, ICICI, Axis – they all seem to be competing to see who can offer the *least* attractive rates.

unnormalised: Speaking of rates, my friend Rakesh just took a loan at 12.5% interest! Seriously, 12.5%! You’d think he was borrowing from a Bollywood loan shark, not SBI. And don’t even get me started on the processing fees. It’s like they’re charging you extra for the privilege of being in debt. ₹2500 plus GST? Wah, kya rate hai!

unnormalised: Now, credit card companies – those guys are the real comedians. They lure you in with promises of cashback and rewards, then hit you with interest rates that could make a rocket scientist weep. A Late payment fee of ₹750? Are they serious? You could buy a whole box of samosas with that! And don't forget annual fees! You get a card for "free", then a year later, Bam! Annual fee shows up! Like a surprise relative at your wedding.

Like a surprise relative at your wedding.

unnormalised: I saw an ad for a "super-duper" credit card offering 0% interest for the first 3 months. It's like saying, "Enjoy free fall for 3 seconds!". Post that, the APR shoots up to an eye-watering 39.9%! Basically, you'll be paying off that impulse purchase of that fancy new kurta for the next 3 lifetimes! Even with EMIs, the end result will be expensive.

unnormalised: My chacha ji, Mr. Sharma, once tried to outsmart the system. He took multiple personal loans from different banks, thinking he could juggle the payments. Let’s just say things didn’t end well. He's now fluent in talking to collections agents from Kotak Mahindra bank. His CIBIL score? Let's just say, it can scare small children.

unnormalised: I think these banks are doing a great job, though. After all, they're teaching all of us valuable life lessons: like, maybe think twice before buying that giant LED TV on credit. Or that trip to Goa that costs ₹50,000! Or that new phone with 256GB storage we really don't need...

unnormalised: So, next time you're tempted to take out a loan, remember Rakesh, Sharma Ji, and my bank balance – or lack thereof. Maybe stick to eating Maggi for a while and saving up.
